title: 38 Last-Minute Prime Day Beauty Deals to Grab, From La Roche Posay to Maybelline
description: Beauty lovers, it's officially the last day of Amazon Prime Day, and the deals have gotten even better since starting July 8. The annual shopping event, which ends tonight at midnight PT (3 AM ET), is packed with steep discounts on products in home, kitchen, tech, wellness, fashion, and (of course) beauty. As shopping experts and Prime Day pros, we understand how overwhelming it's been to scroll through all the offers and find the best deals, but there's no need to worry or stress - we're here to help. If you're still looking for the best deals on beauty products, we've got your back! Amazon Prime Day has no shortage of bang-for-your-buck beauty deals, including makeup, hair care, skin care, nail care, and body care, including several editor-favorite picks from brands like Laneige, Maybelline, and La Roche Posay (yes, that includes Sydney Sweeney's viral lip mask). Regardless of your beauty needs, this is your last chance to stock up on beauty essentials on a budget or try something new for a great price (until October Prime Day, at least). We're talking the perfect face sunscreen for the summer, a vitamin C serum for your skin-care routine, and an acne treatment you'll never get tired of. Prime Day also offers plenty of makeup, body care, and nail must haves. Our Favorite Prime Day Beauty Deals to Shop For those with dry skin: AmLactin Daily Moisturizing Lotion at $13, originally $25 A viral eye mask that lives up to the hype: Grace & Stella Retinol Under Eye Patches at $12, originally $23 A game-changing pimple patch: Hero Cosmetics Mighty Patch at $10, originally $15 A viral facial toning device: NuFace Mini Facial Toning Device at $150, originally $250 A lip mask approved by Sydney Sweeney: Laneige Lip Sleeping Mask at $17, originally $24 Shop more of Popsugar's editor-curated Amazon Prime Day Sale picks and subscribe to our newsletter for more shopping recommendations. And, if you aren't already a Prime Member, you can sign up here. Update on July 11, 2025 at 5:45 PM ET: Updated prices and checked stock for all products.
author: Anvita Reddy
excerpt: The Best Beauty Prime Day Deals Our Editors Actually Love
text: While each product featured is independently selected by our editors, we may include paid promotion. If you buy something through our links, we may earn commission. The annual shopping event, which ends tonight at midnight PT (3 AM ET), is packed with steep discounts on products in home, kitchen, tech, wellness, fashion, and (of course) beauty. As shopping experts and Prime Day pros, we understand how overwhelming it's been to scroll through all the offers and find the best deals, but there's no need to worry or stress — we're here to help. If you're still looking for the best deals on beauty products, we've got your back! Amazon Prime Day has no shortage of bang-for-your-buck beauty deals, including makeup, hair care, skin care, nail care, and body care, including several editor-favorite picks from brands like Laneige, Maybelline, and La Roche Posay (yes, that includes Sydney Sweeney's viral lip mask). Regardless of your beauty needs, this is your last chance to stock up on beauty essentials on a budget or try something new for a great price (until October Prime Day, at least). We're talking the perfect face sunscreen for the summer, a vitamin C serum for your skin-care routine, and an acne treatment you'll never get tired of. Prime Day also offers plenty of makeup, body care, and nail must haves. Our Favorite Prime Day Beauty Deals to Shop For those with dry skin: AmLactin Daily Moisturizing Lotion at $13, originally $25 A viral eye mask that lives up to the hype: Grace & Stella Retinol Under Eye Patches at $12, originally $23 A game-changing pimple patch: Hero Cosmetics Mighty Patch at $10, originally $15 A viral facial toning device: NuFace Mini Facial Toning Device at $150, originally $250 A lip mask approved by Sydney Sweeney: Laneige Lip Sleeping Mask at $17, originally $24 Shop more of Popsugar's editor-curated Amazon Prime Day Sale picks and subscribe to our newsletter for more shopping recommendations. And, if you aren't already a Prime Member, you can sign up here.Update on July 11, 2025 at 5:45 PM ET: Updated prices and checked stock for all products.PS Photography | Anvita ReddyBest Beauty Deal on Lip TreatmentsLaneige Lip Sleeping Mask ($17, originally $24) Featuring hydrating ingredients like coconut oil and shea butter, the Laneige Lip Sleeping Mask is one of the bestselling items on Amazon, and it's worth stocking up on during Prime Day. This hydrating lip mask can revive even the driest lips overnight. Read more in our Laneige Lip Sleeping Mask review. Editor Quote: "Very few cult-favorite beauty products have brought me as much joy as the Laneige Lip Sleeping Mask ($24). Ever since laying my hands on a little tub of it for the first time years ago, it's remained a staple on my bedside table, in my handbag, and on my work desk, just to name a few spots I have them stashed. (Yes, I proudly own several flavors.)" – Marisa Petrarca, contributing shopping editor If you already have the Lip Sleeping Mask from Laneige in your cart, get the Lip Glowy Balm ($13, originally $19) as well for on the go. This has a shinier finish and is great for layering on top of other lip products. It also comes in a bunch of flavors. Read more in our Laneige Lip Glowy Balm review. Editor Quote: "What's nice about the lip balm is that it has a similar consistency to the fan-favorite Lip Sleeping Mask — the brand's creamy overnight lip treatment — but slightly thinner and therefore better suited to wear throughout the day. Plus, the tube applicator makes it easy to swipe on when on the go, and it fits easily inside a purse or a pocket." – Kelsey Garcia, lifestyle directorPS Photography | Larry StansburyBest Beauty Deal on Eye MasksGrace & Stella Retinol Under Eye Patches ($12, originally $23) If you've been struggling with dark, puffy, or red under eyes, the Grace & Stella Under Eye Masks are going to be your saving grace. One pack comes with 24 pairs, and each pair is infused with ingredients like retinol to help energize delicate skin and keep the area looking bright, which you can read more about in our Grace & Stella Retinol Under Eye Patches review.Editor Quote: "From the moment I apply them, the cooling sensation feels like a mini spa treatment, instantly soothing and de-puffing my tired eyes. The patches stay perfectly in place, allowing me to multitask without worrying about them slipping. After just 15 minutes, my undereye area looks visibly brighter, more hydrated, and refreshed — like I actually got eight hours of sleep!" — Larry Stansbury, contributing editor PS Photography | Anvita ReddyBest Beauty Deal on an Exfoliating Body LotionAmLactin Daily Moisturizing Lotion ($13, originally $25) The AmLactin Daily Moisturizing Lotion is at its lowest price yet and there's no better time to stock up. This body moisturizer is formulated with 12 percent lactic acid and will gently exfoliate to reveal softer, smoother skin. This is great for those who have rough and dry skin, but it's also helpful for people dealing with body acne, KP, ingrown hairs, and dark spots or an uneven skin tone. It's a nongreasy formula that is fragrance-free and suitable for all skin types. Read more in our AmLactin Daily Moisturizing Lotion review. Editor Quote: "Whenever my friends ask how I'm able to get buttery-soft skin or how my bikini line looks smooth, I pretty much credit it to consistently using AmLactin's Daily lotion. My 'strawberry skin' is practically gone; I even noticed that my underarms are lighter and more even-toned as well." – Anvita Reddy, former assistant shopping editorPS Photography | Renee RodriguezBest Beauty Deal on a Hydrating MaskBiodance Bio-Collagen Real Deep Mask ($13, originally $19) You've probably seen the Biodance Bio-Collagen Real Deep Mask all over your social feeds for its deep hydration and glass skin-like results. If you've been wondering if it's worth the hype, you can try it for yourself at this low price point. The overnight hydrogel face mask is supposed to help minimize the appearance of pores and deliver firming results. This set comes with four treatments, which is a steal for only $13. Use it whenever you need a hydration boost, including post-flight. Read more in our Biodance Bio-Collagen Real Deep Mask review. Editor Quote: "I've used it three times since I initially purchased a pack of four. Once when my skin was fairly normal, once when I was experiencing some annoying breakouts, and once when I had a massive sunburn on my face. I'm genuinely not sure how, but the mask seemed to help with all of my skin issues." — Renee Rodriguez, staff writer and social produceramazon.comBest Beauty Deal on a Blowout BrushRevlon One Step Volumizer Plus 2.0 Hair Dryer and Hot Air Brush ($28, originally $70) Get on the hot-air-brush bandwagon and treat yourself to the upgraded version of Revlon's bestselling One-Step Volumizer. This might just be its lowest price yet. It has a detachable brush head, making it super easy to travel with. This is another editor favorite for getting smooth and shiny hair without drying it out. Read more in our Revlon One-Step Volumizer Plus review." Editor Quote: "The biggest difference I noticed between this brush and others I've used in the past is how well my hairstyle stayed put. Although I think I've pretty much mastered the '90s blowout, I've often found that the look can fall throughout the day if I don't use a ton of hairspray or texture spray. I didn't use either after the Revlon One-Step Hair Dryer, and my flipped-in ends lasted even after a night of sleeping on them." – RRPS Photography | Naomi ParrisBest Beauty Deal on a Pimple PatchHero Cosmetics Mighty Patch ($10, originally $13) Want to shrink your zits and get rid of whiteheads overnight? The Hero Cosmetics Mighty Patch has you covered. Keep it on for six hours, peel it off, and your zit will be well on its way out. Read the full Hero Cosmetics Mighty Patch review. Editor Quote: "From its unmatched staying power to the undeniable results, I can say that the Hero Cosmetics Mighty Acne Patch truly lives up to the hype. Thanks to its gel formula, the patch gently clings to the skin for hours while effortlessly absorbing all of the gunk in the pimple. This is great, whether you're a heavy sleeper or on the go all day. It also helps you beat the annoying temptation of picking at your face, which helps prevent scabs and scarring caused by popping pimples." — NPamazon.comBest Beauty Deal on a Facial Toning DeviceNuFace Mini Facial Toning Device ($150, originally $250) Looking for a device that will help sculpt your skin in minutes? The NuFace Mini Facial Toning Device will do just that — and more, and it's a whopping 40 percent off for Prime Day, so get it while you still can. Read the full NuFace Mini Facial Toning Device review. Editor Quote: "My jawline looks much sharper after using the NuFace tool, my cheeks look far less puffy, and my eyebrow has a stronger arch than normal; if I didn't know any better, I might've assumed these were before and after photos from a Botox treatment (a testament to the Nuface Mini's effectiveness)." — KWamazon.comBest Beauty Deal on a Sheer SunscreenNeutrogena Ultra Sheer Dry-Touch Sunscreen For Face & Body ($9, originally $13) This non-greasy sunscreen is your perfect partner for protecting your skin from the sun, no matter the occasion. Made with vitamin E, it absorbs quickly without leaving any funky residue. Plus, the lotion formula is non-comedogenic, so it won't clog pores, and it's water-resistant for up to 80 minutes, so feel free to hop into the pool, lake, or ocean. The matte finish also makes it perfect for wearing under makeup.PS Photography | Naomi ParrisBest Beauty Deal on a LipstickMaybelline Super Stay Teddy Lip Tint ($8, originally $13) Looking for an affordable red lipstick? Look no further than this lip tint from Maybelline. Its lightweight formula comes in 10 buildable shades that can be worn on your lips and cheeks. It even promises up to 12 hours of wear, which our editor put to the test. Read more in our Maybelline Super Stay Teddy Lip Tint review.Editor Quote: "While there's an overwhelming amount of lipsticks on the market, Maybelline managed to create a product that's worth purchasing with its distinct, plush feel. The lip tint has an incredibly smooth texture that provides a seamless glide on the lips without feeling sticky. Unlike other lipsticks I've used, the formula stayed on my lips for hours, even through drinking and eating. I didn't have to reapply because the color is so long-lasting. I also love that the hue I tried, Coquettish, delivered a gorgeous shade of red that's not too much for everyday wear, directly catering to my newfound obsession." — Naomi Parris, assistant shopping editoramazon.comBest Beauty Deal on a Cushion FoundationTirtir Mask Fit Red Cushion Foundation ($10, originally $25) Available in 32 shades, ranging from light to deep dark, this TikTok viral cushion foundation is under $20. It's a bestseller in Japan for delivering smooth, glass-skin-like results. It offers buildable coverage with a lightweight feel and a natural, skin-like semi-matte finish. It's one of the few cushion foundations on the market with an expansive shade range, so you'll surely find your match in this.PS Photography | Jessica HarringtonBest Beauty Deal on an Acne Treatment GelDifferin Acne Treatment Gel ($12, originally $16) Dealing with breakouts and acne? There's no better time to stock up on the Differin Acne Treatment Gel. The 0.1 percent adapalene gel is a retinoid treatment best used at night to help diminish acne, post-acne marks, and discoloration over time. Although similar to its prescription-strength counterpart, this treatment is a gentler option if you're looking for something effective but not as potent. Read more in our Differin Acne Treatment Gel review. Editor Quote: "It only took about a month for my skin to get used to, and now, I use it every night with zero irritation. I'm not going to sit here and tell you the Differin Acne Treatment and Differin Acne Treatment alone cleared up my acne, because that's not the case — the spironolactone prescription had a large hand in that — but I can tell you the gel has helped brighten and even out my complexion to the point that you can hardly tell I ever experienced those hormonal breakouts to begin with." — Jessica Harrington, senior beauty editorPS Photography | Anvita ReddyBest Beauty Deal on SunscreenInnisfree Daily UV Defense Sunscreen Broad Spectrum SPF 36 ($13, originally $18) This popular sunscreen from Innisfree feels like a lightweight moisturizer with its water-based formula. Containing skin-calming ingredients like green tea, cica, and sunflower seed oil, this product is perfect for all skin types. Plus, it doesn't leave behind a white cast, but rather a hydrated glow. Read more in our Innisfree Daily UV Defense Sunscreen review. Editor Quote: "In comparison to many other sunscreens I've tried in the past, the Innisfree Daily UV Defense Sunscreen has the best texture. It's smooth and creamy, kind of like a balmy moisturizer, but it still feels so refreshing and lightweight on the skin that I often forget I have SPF on and accidentally double up (which is never a bad idea). Plus, it sets and absorbs nearly immediately after I blend it in. I'm left with a subtle, dewy glow with a natural, skin-like finish. It doesn't make me look like a glazed doughnut, but I don't look extra oily or shiny, either." – ARamazon.comBest Beauty Deal on a Facial CleanserLa Roche Posay Toleriane Purifying Foaming Facial Cleanser ($13, originally $18) This cleanser is ideal for all skin types, from normal to sensitive. It's formulated with the brand's prebiotic thermal spring water, niacinamide, and ceramide-3 that all work to remove excess oil from dirt and makeup, while maintaining the skin's moisture barrier and pH.Editor Quote: "I tried this cleanser when doing my nighttime routine post-makeup, and it's one of the best washes I've used. With just a few squirts, it works so well to remove my makeup (even the most stubborn mascara), and leaves my skin feeling moisturized, even before applying toner and moisturizer. It's a must have in my everyday skin-care routine." — NPamazon.comBest Beauty Deal on a Bath SaltMaude Soak No. 3 Mineral Bath Salt ($13, originally $19) Give your daily shower routine a luxurious boost with this magnesium bath salt blend. Made with hand-harvested salt crystals from the Southern Dead Sea, it will give your skin the nourishing glow it needs, as well as soften it with essential vitamins and minerals. You simply add a handful of the bath salt to warm water and mix until absorbed, before soaking for 20 minutes.PS Photography | Kelsey GarciaBest Beauty Deal on a Hydrating EssenceCosrx Snail Mucin 96% Power Repairing Essence ($13, originally $25) There's a reason this snail mucin essence is all over your social media feed, and it's at its lowest price yet. The lightweight essence soothes redness, brightens the skin, and helps repair your moisture barrier without feeling greasy. If you have dry, irritated skin, this will help with hydration. Read more in our Cosrx Advanced Snail 96 Mucin Power Essence review. Editor Quote: "My skin's texture has actually improved, and it feels way more even now. The hydration payoff is also huge, and I feel like it actually helps my moisturizer work better, too." – KGamazon.comBest Beauty Deal on a PrimerSaie Mini Glowy Super Gel Illuminator ($14, originally $17) This dewy gel works as both a primer and tinted SPF, thanks to ingredients like plant-derived glycerin and vitamin C. It also features rosehip seed oil, which is rich in antioxidants to help visibly brighten and moisturize the skin. You can mix a few drops of it into your go-to foundation or wear it alone for a great natural look.amazon.comBest Beauty Deal on a Cleansing OilAnua Heartleaf Pore Control Cleansing Oil ($14, originally $20) Oil cleansing does wonders for gently breaking down makeup, sunscreen, and the grime from the day. However, it can also help with eliminating blackheads and clearing out your pores. The Anua Heartleaf Pore Control Cleansing Oil will do just that with its soothing formula containing heartleaf extract. Just massage this into your skin for a minute or two, emulisfy it into a milky texture with a little bit of water, and wash it away for a smoother, softer complexion.PS Photography | Renee RodriguezBest Beauty Deal on Hydrating CleanserCeraVe Hydrating Facial Cleanser ($15, originally $20) If you have dry, sensitive skin, the CeraVe Hydrating Facial Cleanser is a no-nonsense cleanser that will get the job done. It is gentle on skin while still being strong enough to remove dirt and makeup, and it features hyaluronic acid to help the skin maintain its moisture barrier. It's worth stocking up on while it's under $20. Read more in our CeraVe Hydrating Facial Cleanser review. Editor Quote: "This face wash was the first product I used that actually left my skin feeling moisturized, meaning that even if I accidentally forget to apply face cream before bed, I won't wake up with dry flakes and red, itchy spots." — RRamazon.comBest Beauty Deal on Whitening StripsGuruNanda Teeth Whitening Strips ($15, originally $21) Looking for a way to whiten your teeth minus the chemicals? Look no further than these whitening strips from GuruNanda. Made with hydrogen peroxide and coconut extracts, these strips help target tough stains from coffee, wine, and smoking, while building your enamel. Another reason to purchase? They're TikTok-approved. They're also available in a seven-day treatment, in case you don't want to commit to this 16-pack right away.amazon.comBest Beauty Deal on Toner PadsMedicube Deep Vita C Pad ($15, originally $32) On the hunt for brighter, blemish-free skin? The Medicube Deep Vita C Pads will give you just that — for a fraction of their normal price this Prime Day. Made with ingredients like niacinamide, sea buckthorn extract, and vitamin C, these two-sided pads help strengthen the skin's barrier and improve the appearance of dark spots.amazon.comBest Beauty Deal on a Cleansing BalmBanila Co. Clean It Zero Original Cleansing Balm ($17, originally $29) This cleansing balm starts as a solid and transforms into a smooth oil as you warm it up in your hands. A small dollop can break down heavy-duty makeup, sunscreen, sweat, dirt, and grime. Read more in our Banila Co. Clean It Zero Original Cleansing Balm review.Editor Quote: "I was shocked that this balm truly removed every last trace of makeup from my face in a matter of seconds, and I didn't have to follow it up with any other product." — Sarah Siegel, former assistant beauty editoramazon.comBest Beauty Deal on a MascaraLancôme Lash Idôle Lash-Lifting & Volumizing Mascara ($18, originally $30) The Lancôme Lash Idôle Mascara is under $25, and it's worth stocking up on. It gives your lashes an instant lift, as well as volumizes and lengthens to give you a fluttery, fanned-out look. It's lengthening without the clumps, and the unique shape of the brush lets you reach and separate every lash from root to tip.amazon.comBest Beauty Deal on SunscreenSupergoop! Play Everyday Lotion SPF 50 ($19, originally $24) If you're a huge fan of Supergoop's Play Everyday Sunscreen, buy now for a discount. Formulated for sensitive skin, this fast absorbing chemical sunscreen is safe for the face and body. It delivers broad spectrum SPF 50 protection and it's water- and sweat-resistant, making it ideal for active days or long days in the sun and water.amazon.comBest Beauty Deal on a Body OilVaseline Intensive Care Cocoa Radiant Body Oil ($19, originally $24) This cocoa body oil from the household brand has over 4,000 ratings, and for good reason. It's made with 100 percent cocoa butter and replenishing oils that serve to hydrate and moisturize your skin to the maximum capacity. Customers also love its non-greasy feel and long-lasting moisture. Editor Quote: "I recently stopped using lotions because I noticed my skin wasn't as hydrated as I wanted it to be. The first product I turned to was this body oil from Vaseline, and I haven't used any other body moisturizer since. Not only does it lather well without feeling heavy, but it also leaves zero residue so I don't have to wait to put on my clothes after moisturizing. I use at least one of them each month." — NP amazon.comBest Beauty Deal on ConcealerTarte Shape Tape Full-Coverage Concealer ($19, originally $32) When it comes to concealers, Tarte takes the trophy. This cult-favorite product delivers 12 hours of crease-free wear and a skin-like finish. Customers find that it conquers dark circles and blemishes, in particular, without looking artificial.PS Photography | Anvita ReddyBest Beauty Deal on an Anti-Humidity Hair TreatmentColor Wow Dream Coat Supernatural Spray ($20, originally $28) This anti-humidity hair treatment is a must-have for the summer, and we're planning on grabbing a few bottles on a budget during Prime Day. It has heat-activated polymers that help to "waterproof" your hair, so you can brave everything from rain to humidity while keeping your blow-out intact. Plus, it can tame frizz while adding shine. Read more in our Color Wow Dream Coat Supernatural Spray review. Editor Quote: "I initially tried the Color Wow Dream Coat Supernatural Spray while getting ready for an outdoor graduation party, and it had just rained. Usually, my hair would turn into a giant, frizzy poof, but now, it just became slightly wavier with no frizz whatsoever." – ARPS Photography | Angela EliasBest Beauty Deal on a Finishing Hair OilOlaplex No. 7 Bonding Oil ($21, originally $30) Olaplex is always worth the investment, especially if you have damaged hair. Right now, you can stock up on its bestselling bonding oil while it's on sale. This versatile hair oil is highly concentrated, so don't let the small packaging fool you! It boosts shine and softness while taming frizz, strengthening hair, and protecting it from heat damage. Read more in our Olaplex No.7 Bonding Oil review. Editor Quote: "The buildable formula is easy to use without worrying about overdoing it, so I usually apply a little every day in between washes. I'm still surprised by how soft my curls feel after applying it. Its star ingredient, Bis-Aminopropyl Diglycol Dimaleate, is part of Olaplex's patented Bond Building Technology that repairs damage by relinking broken bonds. I'm used to running my fingers through my dry split ends, but the bonding oil really helps to smooth and hydrate my usually coarse, dry hair." – Angela Elias, contributing shopping editoramazon.comBest Beauty Deal on a Hair MaskAmika Soulfood Nourishing Mask ($25, originally $36) You can save 30 percent on Amika's bestselling Soulfood Nourishing Mask, which is a great deal for a weekly treatment. This mask infuses your hair with intense hydration and helps to repair dry, damaged hair. After using this mask, you'll have softer, silkier hair that's more manageable.amazon.comBest Beauty Deal on a CC+ CreamIT Cosmetics CC+ Cream and Foundation ($28, originally $47) Hybrid beauty products are all the rage lately, and this cream-meets-foundation is further proof of the trend's staying power. Formulated with ingredients like hyaluronic acid and niacinamide, you can achieve skin that not only looks good, but also stays protected against harmful rays.PS Photography | Jessica HarringtonBest Beauty Deal on Hair OilSquigs Gooseberry Delight Hair Oil ($29, originally $38) This award-winning hair oil is the perfect option if you've been looking for an Ayurvedic hair treatment. Thanks to its blend of amla, castor, and coconut oils, this product works to hydrate dry, brittle hair and repair split ends. One of our editors can attest to its miracle-working properties, stating it made her ends soft after one use. Read more in our Squigs Gooseberry Delight Hair Oil review.Editor Quote: "All in all, I loved the ritual of hair oiling, as well as how it made my hair look. I was expecting hair oiling to be more disruptive to my day because of how long it takes, but I almost forgot that the Squigs Beauty Gooseberry Delight Hair Oil was even in my hair. I'm definitely going to include this treatment in my monthly beauty maintenance routine." — JHamazon.comBest Beauty Deal on Professional-Level WhitestripsCrest 3D Whitestrips Professional Effects ($30, originally $46) The Crest 3D Whitestrips Professional Effects are your smile's answer to looking the best it's ever been. Not only do they have thousands upon thousands of five-star reviews on Amazon, but they're also editor-approved — and on major sale this prime day. Read our editor's Crest 3D Whitestrips review for more details about the brand's products. Editor Quote: "What truly impresses me about Crest 3D Whitestrips is how effective they are. Even though it had been well over a decade since I last used them, I couldn't resist trying them again and added them to my virtual Amazon shopping cart. The box boldly claimed they could 'remove over 15 years of stains in three days,' which initially made me a bit skeptical. However, the results speak for themselves. After just four treatments, the difference is already remarkable." — MPamazon.comBest Beauty Deal on a Lash SerumBabe Original Lash Serum ($37, originally $49) With over 20,000 reviews and a 4.1-star rating, this lash serum is a favorite among Amazon shoppers. The formula contains lash-boosting ingredients like biotin and amino acids to improve the length and fullness of your eyelashes after four weeks of consistent use. If you need proof, just check out the before and after photos in the reviews. Plus, it's ophthalmologist-tested, vegan, and cruelty-free.Amazon.comBest Beauty Deal on a Curling IronHot Tools 24K Gold Extended Barrel Curling Iron 1.5" With Clamp ($40, originally $70) Whether you're looking to master the perfect beach waves or you just want an occasional loose curl, the Hot Tools 24K Gold Extended Barrel Curling Iron can get you there, no problem. It has an extended barrel, so even if you have long hair, you'll still be able to curl your entire head with ease. It has five different heat settings that heat up to 450 degrees.PS Photography | Marisa PetrarcaBest Beauty Deal on a Cleansing BalmElemis Pro-Collagen Cleansing Balm ($48, originally $69) If you love the Elemis Pro-Collagen Cleansing Balm as much as we do, you need to take advantage of the markdowns and stock up. It has a silky texture that makes removing your makeup a relaxing experience. Read more in our Elemis Pro-Collagen Cleansing Balm review. Editor Quote: "The texture starts off as a gel-like balm but transforms into a milky oil as it's massaged into the skin with water. Within seconds, the formula melts even waterproof makeup formulas off of my face. What's more, my skin feels softer to the touch immediately after cleansing. Forget the feeling of stripped skin — this balm will leave your complexion feeling wildly silky and soothed." – MPamazon.comBest Beauty Deal on a Water FlosserWaterpik Aquarius Water Flosser Professional ($50, originally $100) We know — flossing your teeth can sometimes feel like a total chore. If you've been thinking about making the switch over to a water flosser, there's never been a better option than the Waterpik Aquarius Water Flosser — or a better time to purchase it. It has over 21,000 five-star reviews on Amazon, and you can get it for half off right now.amazon.comBest Beauty Deal on a Flat IronT3 Lucea Professional Straightening & Styling Iron ($150, originally $190) T3 products rarely go on sale, so grab this discount while you can. Customers say with just one pass, this flat iron gets their hair straight and shiny, but it can also be used to create the perfect beachy waves or bubble waves. It has nine different heat settings, which makes it the perfect pick for all hair types.amazon.comBest Beauty Deal on a MassagerMedicube Age-R Booster Pro Beauty Massager ($150, originally $228) In case TikTok hasn't already influenced you to invest in a Medicube product, consider Prime Day your bonus sign. This massager is one of the best products to achieve glass skin, with its all-in-one wand that's compatible with any of your go-to skin products. Use it with the Age-R app to track your progress and glow.Editor Quote: "The best thing about this product is that it's essentially six treatments in one. Rather than needing six different devices — like an LED mask, an EMS mask, and a microcurrent device — you can do it all with just one tool." — RRPS Photography | Haley LyndesBest Beauty Deal on a Multifunctional Hair ToolShark FlexStyle Air Drying & Styling System ($250, originally $370) If you want all your hair styling needs covered with one nifty tool, you need to get your hands on the FlexStyle Air Drying & Styling System. This ultimate set contains all seven attachments, including a diffuser, a styling concentrator, a wide-tooth comb attachment, two auto-wrap curlers, a paddle brush attachment, and a round brush attachment. Usually, you only get five according to your hair type for this price point, so you have to take advantage of this Prime Day deal. Plus, you get a set of four nonslip clips as well. Read our Shark FlexStyle Air Drying & Styling System review. Editor Quote: "This is something I personally love because I like to get my hair almost completely dry before I style it. It has a button that allows it to rotate from its blow-dryer shape back into a styling wand, and from there you can use one of its attachments to get your desired result. As someone who was a heavy Revlon user, I personally use its oval brush to style my hair straight, and it does a great job. It's powerful and fast, and it uses low heat to style my hair." – Haley Lyndes, assistant shopping editor- Additional reporting by Renee Rodriguez and Balim TezelAnvita Reddy (she/her) is a former assistant editor for PS Shopping. She has a passion for products and reviews home gadgets, cookware, tech, and more. Having dealt with acne as a teenager and into adulthood, her expertise lies in beauty. At PS, she tested skin care, makeup, and hair care, plus countless other beauty products.Renee Rodriguez (she/her) is a staff writer and social producer for PS. She writes across all verticals, but her main areas of expertise focus on fashion and beauty content with an emphasis on reviews and editor experiments. She also produces social content for PS's TikTok and Instagram accounts.Balim Tezel (she/her) is a shopping updates editor at PS and the founder of Maison des Nus, a New York-based affordable luxury brand. She graduated from Northwestern University's Medill School of Journalism.
html:
While each product featured is independently selected by our editors, we may include paid promotion. If you buy something through our links, we may earn commission. Read more about our Product Review Guidelines here.

Beauty lovers, it's officially the last day of Amazon Prime Day, and the deals have gotten even better since starting July 8. The annual shopping event, which ends tonight at midnight PT (3 AM ET), is packed with steep discounts on products in home, kitchen, tech, wellness, fashion, and (of course) beauty. As shopping experts and Prime Day pros, we understand how overwhelming it's been to scroll through all the offers and find the best deals, but there's no need to worry or stress — we're here to help. If you're still looking for the best deals on beauty products, we've got your back!

Amazon Prime Day has no shortage of bang-for-your-buck beauty deals, including makeup, hair care, skin care, nail care, and body care, including several editor-favorite picks from brands like Laneige, Maybelline, and La Roche Posay (yes, that includes Sydney Sweeney's viral lip mask). Regardless of your beauty needs, this is your last chance to stock up on beauty essentials on a budget or try something new for a great price (until October Prime Day, at least). We're talking the perfect face sunscreen for the summer, a vitamin C serum for your skin-care routine, and an acne treatment you'll never get tired of. Prime Day also offers plenty of makeup, body care, and nail must haves.

Our Favorite Prime Day Beauty Deals to Shop

  • For those with dry skin: AmLactin Daily Moisturizing Lotion at $13, originally $25
  • A viral eye mask that lives up to the hype: Grace & Stella Retinol Under Eye Patches at $12, originally $23
  • A game-changing pimple patch: Hero Cosmetics Mighty Patch at $10, originally $15
  • A viral facial toning device: NuFace Mini Facial Toning Device at $150, originally $250
  • A lip mask approved by Sydney Sweeney: Laneige Lip Sleeping Mask at $17, originally $24

Shop more of Popsugar's editor-curated Amazon Prime Day Sale picks and subscribe to our newsletter for more shopping recommendations. And, if you aren't already a Prime Member, you can sign up here.

Update on July 11, 2025 at 5:45 PM ET: Updated prices and checked stock for all products.

Best Beauty Deal on Lip Treatments

Laneige Lip Sleeping Mask ($17, originally $24)

Featuring hydrating ingredients like coconut oil and shea butter, the Laneige Lip Sleeping Mask is one of the bestselling items on Amazon, and it's worth stocking up on during Prime Day. This hydrating lip mask can revive even the driest lips overnight. Read more in our Laneige Lip Sleeping Mask review.

Editor Quote: "Very few cult-favorite beauty products have brought me as much joy as the Laneige Lip Sleeping Mask ($24). Ever since laying my hands on a little tub of it for the first time years ago, it's remained a staple on my bedside table, in my handbag, and on my work desk, just to name a few spots I have them stashed. (Yes, I proudly own several flavors.)" – Marisa Petrarca, contributing shopping editor

If you already have the Lip Sleeping Mask from Laneige in your cart, get the Lip Glowy Balm ($13, originally $19) as well for on the go. This has a shinier finish and is great for layering on top of other lip products. It also comes in a bunch of flavors. Read more in our Laneige Lip Glowy Balm review.

Editor Quote: "What's nice about the lip balm is that it has a similar consistency to the fan-favorite Lip Sleeping Mask — the brand's creamy overnight lip treatment — but slightly thinner and therefore better suited to wear throughout the day. Plus, the tube applicator makes it easy to swipe on when on the go, and it fits easily inside a purse or a pocket." – Kelsey Garcia, lifestyle director

Best Beauty Deal on Eye Masks

Grace & Stella Retinol Under Eye Patches ($12, originally $23)

If you've been struggling with dark, puffy, or red under eyes, the Grace & Stella Under Eye Masks are going to be your saving grace. One pack comes with 24 pairs, and each pair is infused with ingredients like retinol to help energize delicate skin and keep the area looking bright, which you can read more about in our Grace & Stella Retinol Under Eye Patches review.

Editor Quote: "From the moment I apply them, the cooling sensation feels like a mini spa treatment, instantly soothing and de-puffing my tired eyes. The patches stay perfectly in place, allowing me to multitask without worrying about them slipping. After just 15 minutes, my undereye area looks visibly brighter, more hydrated, and refreshed — like I actually got eight hours of sleep!" — Larry Stansbury, contributing editor

Best Beauty Deal on an Exfoliating Body Lotion

AmLactin Daily Moisturizing Lotion ($13, originally $25)

The AmLactin Daily Moisturizing Lotion is at its lowest price yet and there's no better time to stock up. This body moisturizer is formulated with 12 percent lactic acid and will gently exfoliate to reveal softer, smoother skin. This is great for those who have rough and dry skin, but it's also helpful for people dealing with body acne, KP, ingrown hairs, and dark spots or an uneven skin tone. It's a nongreasy formula that is fragrance-free and suitable for all skin types. Read more in our AmLactin Daily Moisturizing Lotion review.

Editor Quote: "Whenever my friends ask how I'm able to get buttery-soft skin or how my bikini line looks smooth, I pretty much credit it to consistently using AmLactin's Daily lotion. My 'strawberry skin' is practically gone; I even noticed that my underarms are lighter and more even-toned as well." – Anvita Reddy, former assistant shopping editor

Best Beauty Deal on a Hydrating Mask

Biodance Bio-Collagen Real Deep Mask ($13, originally $19)

You've probably seen the Biodance Bio-Collagen Real Deep Mask all over your social feeds for its deep hydration and glass skin-like results. If you've been wondering if it's worth the hype, you can try it for yourself at this low price point. The overnight hydrogel face mask is supposed to help minimize the appearance of pores and deliver firming results. This set comes with four treatments, which is a steal for only $13. Use it whenever you need a hydration boost, including post-flight. Read more in our Biodance Bio-Collagen Real Deep Mask review.

Editor Quote: "I've used it three times since I initially purchased a pack of four. Once when my skin was fairly normal, once when I was experiencing some annoying breakouts, and once when I had a massive sunburn on my face. I'm genuinely not sure how, but the mask seemed to help with all of my skin issues." — Renee Rodriguez, staff writer and social producer

Best Beauty Deal on a Blowout Brush

Revlon One Step Volumizer Plus 2.0 Hair Dryer and Hot Air Brush ($28, originally $70)

Get on the hot-air-brush bandwagon and treat yourself to the upgraded version of Revlon's bestselling One-Step Volumizer. This might just be its lowest price yet. It has a detachable brush head, making it super easy to travel with. This is another editor favorite for getting smooth and shiny hair without drying it out. Read more in our Revlon One-Step Volumizer Plus review."

Editor Quote: "The biggest difference I noticed between this brush and others I've used in the past is how well my hairstyle stayed put. Although I think I've pretty much mastered the '90s blowout, I've often found that the look can fall throughout the day if I don't use a ton of hairspray or texture spray. I didn't use either after the Revlon One-Step Hair Dryer, and my flipped-in ends lasted even after a night of sleeping on them." – RR

Best Beauty Deal on a Pimple Patch

Hero Cosmetics Mighty Patch ($10, originally $13)

Want to shrink your zits and get rid of whiteheads overnight? The Hero Cosmetics Mighty Patch has you covered. Keep it on for six hours, peel it off, and your zit will be well on its way out. Read the full Hero Cosmetics Mighty Patch review.

Editor Quote: "From its unmatched staying power to the undeniable results, I can say that the Hero Cosmetics Mighty Acne Patch truly lives up to the hype. Thanks to its gel formula, the patch gently clings to the skin for hours while effortlessly absorbing all of the gunk in the pimple. This is great, whether you're a heavy sleeper or on the go all day. It also helps you beat the annoying temptation of picking at your face, which helps prevent scabs and scarring caused by popping pimples." — NP

Best Beauty Deal on a Facial Toning Device

NuFace Mini Facial Toning Device ($150, originally $250)

Looking for a device that will help sculpt your skin in minutes? The NuFace Mini Facial Toning Device will do just that — and more, and it's a whopping 40 percent off for Prime Day, so get it while you still can. Read the full NuFace Mini Facial Toning Device review.

Editor Quote: "My jawline looks much sharper after using the NuFace tool, my cheeks look far less puffy, and my eyebrow has a stronger arch than normal; if I didn't know any better, I might've assumed these were before and after photos from a Botox treatment (a testament to the Nuface Mini's effectiveness)." — KW

Best Beauty Deal on a Sheer Sunscreen

Neutrogena Ultra Sheer Dry-Touch Sunscreen For Face & Body ($9, originally $13)

This non-greasy sunscreen is your perfect partner for protecting your skin from the sun, no matter the occasion. Made with vitamin E, it absorbs quickly without leaving any funky residue. Plus, the lotion formula is non-comedogenic, so it won't clog pores, and it's water-resistant for up to 80 minutes, so feel free to hop into the pool, lake, or ocean. The matte finish also makes it perfect for wearing under makeup.

Best Beauty Deal on a Lipstick

Maybelline Super Stay Teddy Lip Tint ($8, originally $13)

Looking for an affordable red lipstick? Look no further than this lip tint from Maybelline. Its lightweight formula comes in 10 buildable shades that can be worn on your lips and cheeks. It even promises up to 12 hours of wear, which our editor put to the test. Read more in our Maybelline Super Stay Teddy Lip Tint review.

Editor Quote: "While there's an overwhelming amount of lipsticks on the market, Maybelline managed to create a product that's worth purchasing with its distinct, plush feel. The lip tint has an incredibly smooth texture that provides a seamless glide on the lips without feeling sticky. Unlike other lipsticks I've used, the formula stayed on my lips for hours, even through drinking and eating. I didn't have to reapply because the color is so long-lasting. I also love that the hue I tried, Coquettish, delivered a gorgeous shade of red that's not too much for everyday wear, directly catering to my newfound obsession." — Naomi Parris, assistant shopping editor

Best Beauty Deal on a Cushion Foundation

Tirtir Mask Fit Red Cushion Foundation ($10, originally $25)

Available in 32 shades, ranging from light to deep dark, this TikTok viral cushion foundation is under $20. It's a bestseller in Japan for delivering smooth, glass-skin-like results. It offers buildable coverage with a lightweight feel and a natural, skin-like semi-matte finish. It's one of the few cushion foundations on the market with an expansive shade range, so you'll surely find your match in this.

Best Beauty Deal on an Acne Treatment Gel

Differin Acne Treatment Gel ($12, originally $16)

Dealing with breakouts and acne? There's no better time to stock up on the Differin Acne Treatment Gel. The 0.1 percent adapalene gel is a retinoid treatment best used at night to help diminish acne, post-acne marks, and discoloration over time. Although similar to its prescription-strength counterpart, this treatment is a gentler option if you're looking for something effective but not as potent. Read more in our Differin Acne Treatment Gel review.

Editor Quote: "It only took about a month for my skin to get used to, and now, I use it every night with zero irritation. I'm not going to sit here and tell you the Differin Acne Treatment and Differin Acne Treatment alone cleared up my acne, because that's not the case — the spironolactone prescription had a large hand in that — but I can tell you the gel has helped brighten and even out my complexion to the point that you can hardly tell I ever experienced those hormonal breakouts to begin with." — Jessica Harrington, senior beauty editor

Best Beauty Deal on Sunscreen

Innisfree Daily UV Defense Sunscreen Broad Spectrum SPF 36 ($13, originally $18)

This popular sunscreen from Innisfree feels like a lightweight moisturizer with its water-based formula. Containing skin-calming ingredients like green tea, cica, and sunflower seed oil, this product is perfect for all skin types. Plus, it doesn't leave behind a white cast, but rather a hydrated glow. Read more in our Innisfree Daily UV Defense Sunscreen review.

Editor Quote: "In comparison to many other sunscreens I've tried in the past, the Innisfree Daily UV Defense Sunscreen has the best texture. It's smooth and creamy, kind of like a balmy moisturizer, but it still feels so refreshing and lightweight on the skin that I often forget I have SPF on and accidentally double up (which is never a bad idea). Plus, it sets and absorbs nearly immediately after I blend it in. I'm left with a subtle, dewy glow with a natural, skin-like finish. It doesn't make me look like a glazed doughnut, but I don't look extra oily or shiny, either." – AR

Best Beauty Deal on a Facial Cleanser

La Roche Posay Toleriane Purifying Foaming Facial Cleanser ($13, originally $18)

This cleanser is ideal for all skin types, from normal to sensitive. It's formulated with the brand's prebiotic thermal spring water, niacinamide, and ceramide-3 that all work to remove excess oil from dirt and makeup, while maintaining the skin's moisture barrier and pH.

Editor Quote: "I tried this cleanser when doing my nighttime routine post-makeup, and it's one of the best washes I've used. With just a few squirts, it works so well to remove my makeup (even the most stubborn mascara), and leaves my skin feeling moisturized, even before applying toner and moisturizer. It's a must have in my everyday skin-care routine." — NP

Best Beauty Deal on a Bath Salt

Maude Soak No. 3 Mineral Bath Salt ($13, originally $19)

Give your daily shower routine a luxurious boost with this magnesium bath salt blend. Made with hand-harvested salt crystals from the Southern Dead Sea, it will give your skin the nourishing glow it needs, as well as soften it with essential vitamins and minerals. You simply add a handful of the bath salt to warm water and mix until absorbed, before soaking for 20 minutes.

Best Beauty Deal on a Hydrating Essence

Cosrx Snail Mucin 96% Power Repairing Essence ($13, originally $25)

There's a reason this snail mucin essence is all over your social media feed, and it's at its lowest price yet. The lightweight essence soothes redness, brightens the skin, and helps repair your moisture barrier without feeling greasy. If you have dry, irritated skin, this will help with hydration. Read more in our Cosrx Advanced Snail 96 Mucin Power Essence review.

Editor Quote: "My skin's texture has actually improved, and it feels way more even now. The hydration payoff is also huge, and I feel like it actually helps my moisturizer work better, too." – KG

Best Beauty Deal on a Primer

Saie Mini Glowy Super Gel Illuminator ($14, originally $17)

This dewy gel works as both a primer and tinted SPF, thanks to ingredients like plant-derived glycerin and vitamin C. It also features rosehip seed oil, which is rich in antioxidants to help visibly brighten and moisturize the skin. You can mix a few drops of it into your go-to foundation or wear it alone for a great natural look.

Best Beauty Deal on a Cleansing Oil

Anua Heartleaf Pore Control Cleansing Oil ($14, originally $20)

Oil cleansing does wonders for gently breaking down makeup, sunscreen, and the grime from the day. However, it can also help with eliminating blackheads and clearing out your pores. The Anua Heartleaf Pore Control Cleansing Oil will do just that with its soothing formula containing heartleaf extract. Just massage this into your skin for a minute or two, emulisfy it into a milky texture with a little bit of water, and wash it away for a smoother, softer complexion.

Best Beauty Deal on Hydrating Cleanser

CeraVe Hydrating Facial Cleanser ($15, originally $20)

If you have dry, sensitive skin, the CeraVe Hydrating Facial Cleanser is a no-nonsense cleanser that will get the job done. It is gentle on skin while still being strong enough to remove dirt and makeup, and it features hyaluronic acid to help the skin maintain its moisture barrier. It's worth stocking up on while it's under $20. Read more in our CeraVe Hydrating Facial Cleanser review.

Editor Quote: "This face wash was the first product I used that actually left my skin feeling moisturized, meaning that even if I accidentally forget to apply face cream before bed, I won't wake up with dry flakes and red, itchy spots." — RR

Best Beauty Deal on Whitening Strips

GuruNanda Teeth Whitening Strips ($15, originally $21)

Looking for a way to whiten your teeth minus the chemicals? Look no further than these whitening strips from GuruNanda. Made with hydrogen peroxide and coconut extracts, these strips help target tough stains from coffee, wine, and smoking, while building your enamel. Another reason to purchase? They're TikTok-approved. They're also available in a seven-day treatment, in case you don't want to commit to this 16-pack right away.

Best Beauty Deal on Toner Pads

Medicube Deep Vita C Pad ($15, originally $32)

On the hunt for brighter, blemish-free skin? The Medicube Deep Vita C Pads will give you just that — for a fraction of their normal price this Prime Day. Made with ingredients like niacinamide, sea buckthorn extract, and vitamin C, these two-sided pads help strengthen the skin's barrier and improve the appearance of dark spots.

Best Beauty Deal on a Cleansing Balm

Banila Co. Clean It Zero Original Cleansing Balm ($17, originally $29)

This cleansing balm starts as a solid and transforms into a smooth oil as you warm it up in your hands. A small dollop can break down heavy-duty makeup, sunscreen, sweat, dirt, and grime. Read more in our Banila Co. Clean It Zero Original Cleansing Balm review.

Editor Quote: "I was shocked that this balm truly removed every last trace of makeup from my face in a matter of seconds, and I didn't have to follow it up with any other product." — Sarah Siegel, former assistant beauty editor

Best Beauty Deal on a Mascara

Lancôme Lash Idôle Lash-Lifting & Volumizing Mascara ($18, originally $30)

The Lancôme Lash Idôle Mascara is under $25, and it's worth stocking up on. It gives your lashes an instant lift, as well as volumizes and lengthens to give you a fluttery, fanned-out look. It's lengthening without the clumps, and the unique shape of the brush lets you reach and separate every lash from root to tip.

Best Beauty Deal on Sunscreen

Supergoop! Play Everyday Lotion SPF 50 ($19, originally $24)

If you're a huge fan of Supergoop's Play Everyday Sunscreen, buy now for a discount. Formulated for sensitive skin, this fast absorbing chemical sunscreen is safe for the face and body. It delivers broad spectrum SPF 50 protection and it's water- and sweat-resistant, making it ideal for active days or long days in the sun and water.

Best Beauty Deal on a Body Oil

Vaseline Intensive Care Cocoa Radiant Body Oil ($19, originally $24)

This cocoa body oil from the household brand has over 4,000 ratings, and for good reason. It's made with 100 percent cocoa butter and replenishing oils that serve to hydrate and moisturize your skin to the maximum capacity. Customers also love its non-greasy feel and long-lasting moisture.

Editor Quote: "I recently stopped using lotions because I noticed my skin wasn't as hydrated as I wanted it to be. The first product I turned to was this body oil from Vaseline, and I haven't used any other body moisturizer since. Not only does it lather well without feeling heavy, but it also leaves zero residue so I don't have to wait to put on my clothes after moisturizing. I use at least one of them each month." — NP

Best Beauty Deal on Concealer

Tarte Shape Tape Full-Coverage Concealer ($19, originally $32)

When it comes to concealers, Tarte takes the trophy. This cult-favorite product delivers 12 hours of crease-free wear and a skin-like finish. Customers find that it conquers dark circles and blemishes, in particular, without looking artificial.

Best Beauty Deal on an Anti-Humidity Hair Treatment

Color Wow Dream Coat Supernatural Spray ($20, originally $28)

This anti-humidity hair treatment is a must-have for the summer, and we're planning on grabbing a few bottles on a budget during Prime Day. It has heat-activated polymers that help to "waterproof" your hair, so you can brave everything from rain to humidity while keeping your blow-out intact. Plus, it can tame frizz while adding shine. Read more in our Color Wow Dream Coat Supernatural Spray review.

Editor Quote: "I initially tried the Color Wow Dream Coat Supernatural Spray while getting ready for an outdoor graduation party, and it had just rained. Usually, my hair would turn into a giant, frizzy poof, but now, it just became slightly wavier with no frizz whatsoever." – AR

Best Beauty Deal on a Finishing Hair Oil

Olaplex No. 7 Bonding Oil ($21, originally $30)

Olaplex is always worth the investment, especially if you have damaged hair. Right now, you can stock up on its bestselling bonding oil while it's on sale. This versatile hair oil is highly concentrated, so don't let the small packaging fool you! It boosts shine and softness while taming frizz, strengthening hair, and protecting it from heat damage. Read more in our Olaplex No.7 Bonding Oil review.

Editor Quote: "The buildable formula is easy to use without worrying about overdoing it, so I usually apply a little every day in between washes. I'm still surprised by how soft my curls feel after applying it. Its star ingredient, Bis-Aminopropyl Diglycol Dimaleate, is part of Olaplex's patented Bond Building Technology that repairs damage by relinking broken bonds. I'm used to running my fingers through my dry split ends, but the bonding oil really helps to smooth and hydrate my usually coarse, dry hair." – Angela Elias, contributing shopping editor

Best Beauty Deal on a Hair Mask

Amika Soulfood Nourishing Mask ($25, originally $36)

You can save 30 percent on Amika's bestselling Soulfood Nourishing Mask, which is a great deal for a weekly treatment. This mask infuses your hair with intense hydration and helps to repair dry, damaged hair. After using this mask, you'll have softer, silkier hair that's more manageable.

Best Beauty Deal on a CC+ Cream

IT Cosmetics CC+ Cream and Foundation ($28, originally $47)

Hybrid beauty products are all the rage lately, and this cream-meets-foundation is further proof of the trend's staying power. Formulated with ingredients like hyaluronic acid and niacinamide, you can achieve skin that not only looks good, but also stays protected against harmful rays.

Best Beauty Deal on Hair Oil

Squigs Gooseberry Delight Hair Oil ($29, originally $38)

This award-winning hair oil is the perfect option if you've been looking for an Ayurvedic hair treatment. Thanks to its blend of amla, castor, and coconut oils, this product works to hydrate dry, brittle hair and repair split ends. One of our editors can attest to its miracle-working properties, stating it made her ends soft after one use. Read more in our Squigs Gooseberry Delight Hair Oil review.

Editor Quote: "All in all, I loved the ritual of hair oiling, as well as how it made my hair look. I was expecting hair oiling to be more disruptive to my day because of how long it takes, but I almost forgot that the Squigs Beauty Gooseberry Delight Hair Oil was even in my hair. I'm definitely going to include this treatment in my monthly beauty maintenance routine." — JH

Best Beauty Deal on Professional-Level Whitestrips

Crest 3D Whitestrips Professional Effects ($30, originally $46)

The Crest 3D Whitestrips Professional Effects are your smile's answer to looking the best it's ever been. Not only do they have thousands upon thousands of five-star reviews on Amazon, but they're also editor-approved — and on major sale this prime day. Read our editor's Crest 3D Whitestrips review for more details about the brand's products.

Editor Quote: "What truly impresses me about Crest 3D Whitestrips is how effective they are. Even though it had been well over a decade since I last used them, I couldn't resist trying them again and added them to my virtual Amazon shopping cart. The box boldly claimed they could 'remove over 15 years of stains in three days,' which initially made me a bit skeptical. However, the results speak for themselves. After just four treatments, the difference is already remarkable." — MP

Best Beauty Deal on a Lash Serum

Babe Original Lash Serum ($37, originally $49)
With over 20,000 reviews and a 4.1-star rating, this lash serum is a favorite among Amazon shoppers. The formula contains lash-boosting ingredients like biotin and amino acids to improve the length and fullness of your eyelashes after four weeks of consistent use. If you need proof, just check out the before and after photos in the reviews. Plus, it's ophthalmologist-tested, vegan, and cruelty-free.

Best Beauty Deal on a Curling Iron

Hot Tools 24K Gold Extended Barrel Curling Iron 1.5" With Clamp ($40, originally $70)

Whether you're looking to master the perfect beach waves or you just want an occasional loose curl, the Hot Tools 24K Gold Extended Barrel Curling Iron can get you there, no problem. It has an extended barrel, so even if you have long hair, you'll still be able to curl your entire head with ease. It has five different heat settings that heat up to 450 degrees.

Best Beauty Deal on a Cleansing Balm

Elemis Pro-Collagen Cleansing Balm ($48, originally $69)

If you love the Elemis Pro-Collagen Cleansing Balm as much as we do, you need to take advantage of the markdowns and stock up. It has a silky texture that makes removing your makeup a relaxing experience. Read more in our Elemis Pro-Collagen Cleansing Balm review.

Editor Quote: "The texture starts off as a gel-like balm but transforms into a milky oil as it's massaged into the skin with water. Within seconds, the formula melts even waterproof makeup formulas off of my face. What's more, my skin feels softer to the touch immediately after cleansing. Forget the feeling of stripped skin — this balm will leave your complexion feeling wildly silky and soothed." – MP

Best Beauty Deal on a Water Flosser

Waterpik Aquarius Water Flosser Professional ($50, originally $100)

We know — flossing your teeth can sometimes feel like a total chore. If you've been thinking about making the switch over to a water flosser, there's never been a better option than the Waterpik Aquarius Water Flosser — or a better time to purchase it. It has over 21,000 five-star reviews on Amazon, and you can get it for half off right now.

Best Beauty Deal on a Flat Iron

T3 Lucea Professional Straightening & Styling Iron ($150, originally $190)

T3 products rarely go on sale, so grab this discount while you can. Customers say with just one pass, this flat iron gets their hair straight and shiny, but it can also be used to create the perfect beachy waves or bubble waves. It has nine different heat settings, which makes it the perfect pick for all hair types.

Best Beauty Deal on a Massager

Medicube Age-R Booster Pro Beauty Massager ($150, originally $228)

In case TikTok hasn't already influenced you to invest in a Medicube product, consider Prime Day your bonus sign. This massager is one of the best products to achieve glass skin, with its all-in-one wand that's compatible with any of your go-to skin products. Use it with the Age-R app to track your progress and glow.

Editor Quote: "The best thing about this product is that it's essentially six treatments in one. Rather than needing six different devices — like an LED mask, an EMS mask, and a microcurrent device — you can do it all with just one tool." — RR

Best Beauty Deal on a Multifunctional Hair Tool

Shark FlexStyle Air Drying & Styling System ($250, originally $370)

If you want all your hair styling needs covered with one nifty tool, you need to get your hands on the FlexStyle Air Drying & Styling System. This ultimate set contains all seven attachments, including a diffuser, a styling concentrator, a wide-tooth comb attachment, two auto-wrap curlers, a paddle brush attachment, and a round brush attachment. Usually, you only get five according to your hair type for this price point, so you have to take advantage of this Prime Day deal. Plus, you get a set of four nonslip clips as well. Read our Shark FlexStyle Air Drying & Styling System review.

Editor Quote: "This is something I personally love because I like to get my hair almost completely dry before I style it. It has a button that allows it to rotate from its blow-dryer shape back into a styling wand, and from there you can use one of its attachments to get your desired result. As someone who was a heavy Revlon user, I personally use its oval brush to style my hair straight, and it does a great job. It's powerful and fast, and it uses low heat to style my hair." – Haley Lyndes, assistant shopping editor

- Additional reporting by Renee Rodriguez and Balim Tezel

Anvita Reddy (she/her) is a former assistant editor for PS Shopping. She has a passion for products and reviews home gadgets, cookware, tech, and more. Having dealt with acne as a teenager and into adulthood, her expertise lies in beauty. At PS, she tested skin care, makeup, and hair care, plus countless other beauty products.

Renee Rodriguez (she/her) is a staff writer and social producer for PS. She writes across all verticals, but her main areas of expertise focus on fashion and beauty content with an emphasis on reviews and editor experiments. She also produces social content for PS's TikTok and Instagram accounts.

Balim Tezel (she/her) is a shopping updates editor at PS and the founder of Maison des Nus, a New York-based affordable luxury brand. She graduated from Northwestern University's Medill School of Journalism.
